column4: i stuck /dev/sda3 in fstab to mount at startup, but its not mounting.... what am i doing wrong
bastid_razor can you give me some syntax to use to mount /dev/sda3 in /home on startup with a variable UUID
oh i realize that, i need the other syntax bastid_razor
bastid_razor like UUID= 12421048721491274 /home stuff here

see you later bastid_razor
mean_admin try to format it?
mean_admin or do you have files on it.
no files but I've formatted it once wiht gpartioner from inside the system
I don't understand, why didn't gparted work from inside the OS ?
good enough for me :)
ubuntu doesn't auto mount partitions that aren't the one you installed with, you have to edit fstab
yeah you're right, however, it can't even mount it ad-hoc (well actually, it's so much more weird than that, I just can't grasp what's happening)
have you tried doing a cmd line approach
what is the actual name of the drive
I don't know! :(
don't know how to list mountable partitions
: sudo mount -t /dev/sda3 /mnt
sudo mount -t ext3 /dev/sda3 /mnt
sorry, heh, so, "/dev/sda3" shoud be replaced by the real name ?
yes, but that's likely the name
